properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 21 at 3:01AM MST until January 21 at 6:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque NM
properties.description:
...A DISTURBANCE TO BRING SNOW TO PARTS OF NORTH CENTRAL AND
WESTERN NM...

.A storm system will cross the state from the west today through
this evening with rain and snow. Anomalously high moisture
associated with this system will result in a few to several inches
of snow over the northern and west central mountains, as well as
the northwest highlands with near a foot atop mountain peaks. The
snow level will drop to valley bottoms this morning then rise
above 7000 feet this afternoon, and then drop some this evening as
the storm exits to the east.

* WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of up to 3
inches.

* WHERE...Glorieta Mesa Including Glorieta Pass.

* WHEN...From 7 AM this morning to 6 PM MST this evening.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions, most notably during
mid-day and early afternoon along the I-25 corridor at Glorieta
Pass.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means
that periods of snow will primarily cause travel difficulties.
Be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for New Mexico can be obtained by
calling 5 1 1, 1-800-432-4269, or visiting nmroads.com.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 7 AM THIS MORNING TO 6 PM MST THIS EVENING
